	We&#39;re seeking a Junior Network Engineer to join our IT team.
	As a Junior Network Engineer, you&#39;ll assist in designing, implementing, maintaining our network infrastructure and general IT support.

	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Preferred Qualifications:


	CompTIA Network+ or Cisco CCNA certification
	Experience with network security measures.


Method of Application

Junior Network Engineer and IT Support Officer Job at  SRS Collection




        
    

        
        The SRS Collection stands as a beacon of premier luxury, health, and wellness hospitality, celebrated for crafting bespoke wellness and lifestyle retreats tailored to discerning business and leisure travelers alike. With three illustrious properties nestled in central Lagos.

Envision a home away from home that not only exudes refined style and opulent finishes but also delivers bespoke services and experiences that linger in memory. Our spaces seamlessly blend contemporary aesthetics with minimalist design, making SRS Collection the quintessential lifestyle sanctuary.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Network Engineer and IT Support Officer
     

            
    



Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: IT Manager

Job Summary


	We're seeking a Junior Network Engineer to join our IT team.
	As a Junior Network Engineer, you'll assist in designing, implementing, maintaining our network infrastructure and general IT support.
	This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience and develop your skills in network engineering.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in network design, implementation, and maintenance
	Configure and troubleshoot network devices (routers, switches, firewalls)
	Monitor network performance and identify areas for improvement
	Collaborate with senior engineers on network projects
	Provide technical support for network-related issues
	Document network configurations and procedures
	Stay updated with industry developments and best practices.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Networking, or related fields with 1 - 3 years of work experience
	Basic understanding of network protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP) and VLANs.
	Familiarity with network devices (routers, switches, firewalls)
	Experience with network management tools (optional)
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Preferred Qualifications:


	CompTIA Network+ or Cisco CCNA certification
	Experience with network security measures.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to: hrsupport@srscollection.com using the Job Position as subject of the email.

Executive Assistant to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Job at Serviq Multiservices Limited




        
    

        
        Serviq Multiservices Limited - Our client, one of Nigeria`s Leading Telecom Giants, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO)

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Telecommunications

Summary
     

            
    




	Are you a dynamic, detail-oriented professional with a flair for project management and data-driven decision-making? We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant (EA) to support our Chief Financial Officer (CFO).
	This is not your typical EA role, we’re seeking a strategic partner who thrives in a fast-paced environment and brings strong project management expertise and Power BI proficiency to the table.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide high-level executive and administrative support to the CFO.
	Coordinate financial and cross-functional projects, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business goals.
	Track, analyze, and present key metrics using Power BI to support data-driven decision-making.
	Organize and prepare materials for meetings, presentations, and business reports.
	Manage complex calendars, travel arrangements, and stakeholder communications.
	Facilitate internal and external collaboration between the CFO’s office and key partners.


Required Skills & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience supporting C-level executives, preferably within telecoms or FMCG.
	Strong project management skills with the ability to lead, track, and report progress effectively.
	Advanced proficiency in Power BI – must be able to build, analyze, and interpret dashboards independently.
	Excellent communication, organizational, and stakeholder management skills.
	High degree of professionalism, discretion, and emotional intelligence.
	Power Bi and Project Management (Required).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: serviqmultiservices@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Claims / Underwriting Officer Job at Redswitch",
  "description": "Redswitch is a dynamic and innovative consultancy firm that specializes in providing strategic advice and tailored solutions across a wide array of industries. With a focus on enhancing business performance and solving complex challenges, we collaborate closely with our clients to deliver measurable results that drive growth and sustainability. Whether it&rsquo;s optimizing operations, improving financial performance, or navigating industry-specific challenges, we help organizations reach their full potential.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Claims / Underwriting Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Description


	The Claims/Underwriting Officer will be responsible for overseeing the smooth handling of insurance claims, ensuring timely and accurate processing, and supporting underwriting tasks.
	You will act as a liaison between the firm, underwriters, and clients, ensuring excellent service delivery.


Responsibilities


	Administer and manage insurance claims efficiently.
	Verify policy details and ensure accurate, timely processing of claims.
	Analyze claims to determine if they are covered by policy terms.
	Notify underwriters of all valid claims promptly.
	Prepare and submit weekly reports on claims progress.
	Communicate with clients to obtain necessary information for claims processing.
	Guide policyholders through claims reporting and administration procedures.
	Clarify indemnity amounts and resolve disputes regarding claims.
	Provide technical support on insurance matters to clients and internal staff.
	Assist with the placement of various insurance policies when needed.
	Perform other duties as assigned by management.


Requirements


	Proven experience in claims handling and/or insurance underwriting.
	Strong knowledge of insurance products and claim procedures.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	High attention to detail and strong analytical abilities.
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks.
	Professional and client-focused approach to work.


Salary
